A note. With my name scrawled across it in shaky, familiar handwriting. Henri's handwriting.

I snatched it up, heart hammering again as I unfolded the paper. But there was nothing inside but empty lines, a mocking blankness that seemed to sneer at me.

Whoever left that note knew something. Knew about Henri, about our life together, about secrets we'd long since buried. They're watching me, I know they are. And they won't stop until they've dragged every last one of those secrets into the light.

I'm not safe here anymore. Not in my own home, not with all these fucking shadows and whispers closing in around me. I don't know who to trust, who's on my side. But I do know one thing for certain: I need to find out who's behind this before they drive me mad.
